meanings.definition: One who pretends to have a particular feeling or attitude.
meanings.sent1: The affecter at the party pretended to be happy when he was actually sad.
meanings.sent2: She knew he was an affecter because his smile didn't reach his eyes.
meanings.sent3: The affecter's fake laughter fooled no one at the comedy show.
meanings.sent4: His role as an affecter in the play was so convincing, it left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The affecter's insincere apology fell flat with his friends.

meanings.definition: To make a pretense of; feign.
meanings.sent1: She tried to affecter interest in the boring conversation.
meanings.sent2: He would often affecter a British accent when speaking to strangers.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to affecter innocence after knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The politician's attempt to affecter humility seemed forced and insincere.
meanings.sent5: The actor had to affecter fear during the intense scene.

meanings.definition: To put on a false show of; simulate.
meanings.sent1: The magician could affecter magic with his sleight of hand tricks.
meanings.sent2: She would affecter enthusiasm for the team even though she didn't care.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to affecter human emotions.
meanings.sent4: The artist could affecter sunlight streaming through the window with just paint.
meanings.sent5: The spy had to affecter a different identity to blend in with the crowd.
